content.text:
# William J. Warfield

William J. Warfield (7 Jun 1883 - 12 Feb 1966), was an officer in the Illinois National Guard and a state legislator in Illinois. He represented part of Chicago. He was elected in 1928 to represent the 5th District.
He was a Lieutenant in the Illinois National Guard deployed to the Mexican border and then to Europe during World War I where his black unit was deployed under French command because of segregation. He became a Brigadier General in the Illinois National Guard. He was a Republican. He died at 82 years old. [https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/101151467/william-j-warfield]
He was photographed with fellow black officers Otis B. Duncan and J. R. White.
He was awarded the Distinguished Service Cross.
